inn1.comm: round the stumps, middle stump, no turn and defended back to the bowler
shorter this time but a bit of turn and bounce away from the bat, left alone
outside the off, the batsman was playing at it, defending at it, but misses the outside edge, through to the keeper
whoa, loads of turn there, on the off stump and it fizzes away, left alone
floated up to the bat and Gayle gets his pad down and defends
big appeal for an lbw, it was one pitched on the middle and Gayle saw the opportunity to go for the sweep, misses and hits the pads...was it going down?
on his pads and easily tucked away through fine-leg for a four. the fine-leg was inside the circle and beat him to his left
on the off stump, not too quick, fuller and the batsman defends it back, goes to mid-off
almost got him! short of length, angling away and beats the outside edge of the bat, through to the 'keeper
outside the off and left alone by the batsman this time
slower one, fuller and punched down the ground for a four! this is just the second over of the day and a quick bowler is already bowling slower ones!
slower again, short of length outside the off and defended it to covers
floated up to the bat, pitched up and he drives it well, but to the cover fielder

big appeal for stumping, third ump called! it was slower, and there it was shorter too, Gayle wanted to go down to play at it before realising its length. he had lifted his back foot but got the foot back in time before the bails were removed
goes for a sweep and misses! hits him high on the knee roll and no appeal this time
short of length, goes on the back foot and punches it to long-off for a single
quicker outside the off and he lets it go through to the keeper
another one that is pushed through on the off stump, the batsman has to play at it, smothers the bit of turn, defends
short of length and on the middle stump, defended on the back foot.
another one that straightens after pitching, short of length and Gayle stands tall, taps it to the off side
was going down the track, with a back lift, and then brings it down in a hurry, defends it to the mid-wicket
stump to stump bowling, works it away to the leg side for a single this time
on the off stump, that channel continues this over after a poor first over, defended on the back foot by Powell
slower outside the off stump, he awaits for the arrival before defending it to the off side
drifts down the leg side, probably trying to get him out lbw like the last ball of his previous over, the drift takes it further down and it is helped on its way to the fence
on the off stump, slower and Gayle defends it to the off side
quicker, pulls his length back a little and defended to the off side, they are away for a quick single
inside out and hit to wide long-on, good shot that but surprisingly only a single! Powell hit it and stood there for a second admiring it, costing him one more
on the middle and goes for the sweep, trickles down to short fine-leg
flighted up to the bat and Gayle's eyes light up, goes for a drive, gets bit of an inside edge and a misfield on the off side gets him a single

outside the off and left alone by Gayle, who first wanted to go for the slash but on second thoughts, let it go, the ball swings after it passes the batsman, making it a tad difficult for Rahim, but well collected
goes down the pitch and wanted to smack it over mid-wicket, does not time it too well but enough to get it through that same area for a four
up and over and will it go all the way, yes it does! it was short, wide and most left-handers would have given that a kitchen sink, this is Gayle, and he does just that, hit over the covers!
slower, back of length and defended to the off side this time by Gayle
goes down the track and wants to spank it over the extra-cover, gets bit of an edge and the mistimed shot only flies over the in-field, for a couple of runs

goes down the track, and caught! whoa, the big fish, Gayle was going after every ball and mistiming a lot of them, he went after this one too, got very under it, gets a lot of elevation but not the distance. Gazi is at mid-off and he catches it well, so when he is not picking up Gayle's wicket, he is catching him out!
wants to go down the pitch, it is floated up, gets a bit of an inside edge to square-leg for a single
on the middle, fuller and driven to mid-on
middle stump line from round the stumps, defended on the front foot
short of length, wants to cut it away but gets it to the extra-cover fielder
quicker and sharp turn for Gazi, pushes it to backward point and wants a single, sent back
slower outside the off, lets it go and sees it turn further away from him
bowls it fuller, on the middle and angling in, Samuels is on the back foot, defending to the leg side for a single
short of length and the batsman is on his back foot, defended to the ball that is on the middle-stump
on the off stump channel, it deviates back into the left-hander slightly and he is still able to tap it away to third-man for a single
continues the back of length bowling, wicket to wicket and Samuels is back and defends
slower from Mortaza but does not give up on that line and length that he has been bowling throughout, length ball and on the middle, Samuels pushes to the leg side and is quickly off the blocks
this time he misses his line a little, the batsman has moved across and this one on the middle is tucked away to deep square-leg for a couple
on the middle stump, pushed to the leg side
shorter outside the off, back foot and defended to the off side
drifts on his pads this time, and Samuels is able to tuck it away for a single
shorter, quicker and he wants to cut it, misses the outside edge, through to the keeper
again one that is short but there is turn away and more bounce, the cut it well played but to the fielder
more turn away, but what will be a bother is the amount of bounce, Powell goes back and taps it the point fielder

edged and dropped in the slips by Naeem Islam! it was short of length and came up sharply on the batsman who tried to open the face of the bat, almost fending it off, straight to the wide slip, dropped
short of length, pushed to the mid-on on the back foot and goes for a quick one, Razzaq comes around and throws the ball at the non-striker's end, misses
short of length and he goes on to the back foot, defended back
wow, that comes in now and has Samuels pulling his left hand away, from a good length and angles in, but unlike the previous ones, the ball does not go away, the batsman is hit on his gloves
and that's taken off, unfortunately for the bowler, it is down the leg side, given wide, well-taken by the keeper
pitched right up to the bat and on the off stump, driven but straight to the cover fielder
slower one on the off stump, bit of turn and Samuels continues to take his bottom hand away and defends it to the leg side
off the back foot this time, cuts it hard but gets an outside edge, beats the first slip and rolls away to the fence
slower on the middle and slight turn, defended on the back foot
quicker and outside the off, he opens the face of the bat gently and easily gets it away through the backward point region
on the middle stump and without too much turn, tries to tuck it away but hits the pad and drifts away
short and spinning into the batsman, pushes it away to the leg side for a single
very short, he goes back on to the back foot and pushes it in the region of mid-off
short of length, on the back foot, pushed to the fine-leg for a single
short of length, on the middle stump, almost fends at it, misses the outside edge through to the keeper
short of length, but down the leg side, he goes for a pull, misses
short of length, not pitching anything in the batsman's half, he goes back to defend
again a length ball, no use of feet there and gets a bit of an inside edge there on to his pads
as is the case throughout this over, short of length on the off, angling away and defended back to the right of the bowler
slightly outside the off and comes back into the batsman, who pats it back, bit of an appeal
shorter and Samuels rocks back and caresses it away but to the fielder at short cover
slower on the off stump, fuller too and defended on the front foot to the off side
turn away from the batsman, pushes it to the covers, the non-striker wanted a single but is sent back in time by Samuels
fuller on the middle and driven down the ground, the mid-on fielder runs across to stop it, gets only a single
round the stumps, fuller and drilled down the ground for a single
swept away to one that is fullish, straight to the deep square-leg region for a single
good shot, it was angling in and Samuels manages to hit it against the turn through mid-wicket for a four!
on the middle, pulls back his length and defended back to the bowler
short of length and he is on the back foot, punched to the cover fielder, does well to field it
shorter, and he is on the back foot, punched to wide long-on but for only a single
straighter but slower, Samuels expected a bit of spin there, played for the turn and beaten, hits the pads
short, wide and turning away, wanted to cut, but does not connect too well
over the wicket, on the middle stump, pushed to the leg side for a single
beaten outside the off! that one turned from round the stumps, angles in and then skids away from the outside edge
on the leg stump, quicker and defended back to the bowler
quickish ball again and Samuels is late on the stroke, hits his pads but is going down the leg side
slower from over the wickets, slightly shorter and easily pushed away to deep square-leg
fullish on the leg-stump from round the stumps, defended
whoa, turn and bounce! coming in with the angle and then turning away from the batsman, misses the outside edge
drifts into the batsman, defended on the front foot by Samuels
another one dropped! this should have been caught and bowled by Sunny, it was driven, almost check-driven and was going to his left, low down, dived down and then dropped it!
goes down the track and wants to drive it, bit of an inside edge to deep square-leg for a single
shot, over mid-on for four! enough of pushing and prodding for Samuels, he goes after Razzaq, hits it over mid-on and gets a four
shorter and quicker outside the off, no turn there and Samuels allows it go
fuller on the middle stump and driven back to the bowler
shorter from Razzaq and Samuels is on the back foot this, times it well and gets it through to the left of the sweeper, for a couple
super shot from Samuels; it was quicker and straight and he almost took it from the stumps, slices it through the backward point region for the second four this over
slows the pace down and Samuels pats it to the off side, with soft hands and is off for a single

gone, caught at long-off! third time unlucky Samuels, he was going after them and he tried to hit it over long-off, but the turn defeats the stroke, gets it in the bottom of the bat, it flies off to long-off who takes a very easy catch there!
fuller, flighted outside the off and neatly driven through the covers for a four, as easy as it can get against the turn!
whoa, serious turn into the batsman, on the off stump and it fizzes to the leg stump, pushed to the leg side
quicker and on the off, more turn again and pushed down to mid-on
slower and makes it dip on to the batsman, tapped to the leg side
plays it away to the square-leg, wants to go for a single does Powell but is sent back, Rahim cries out to the fielder but by the time throw comes in, Powell's back home

Bowled him, first baller! Samuels had played one like this but got an inside edge last over, this one though Dwayne Smith misses completely and is castled! a straighter one sneaks through his non-existing defenses and the batsman walks back
on the middle stump and defended on the off side
outside the off and a tad shorter too, on the back foot and pushed to the off side
quicker on the middle and he is bat and pad forward, defending
shorter from the bowler, slower and defended to the covers
on the middle from short of length, pushed to the leg side
fuller from over the stumps, pushed to the off side and wants a single but the non striker sends him back
turn and bounce into the batsman, he wants to play it to the leg side but gets no bat to it

gone, lbw, Sunny is on fire! that spins in viciously again, it was very outside the off stump the batsman was on the back foot, wanting to tuck it away to the deep fielder on the leg side but misses it, the ball hits him in line with the off stump and despite the huge amount of turn, it did look like it would go on to his the stumps
fuller from round the stumps, defended on the front foot, defended back to the bowler
drifts into the bat and spins away from the right-hander, no way he was touching that
and it's almost gone for a six...the bat I mean! he goes for a slog over mid-wicket and loses his bat, goes for a toss! luckily the ball was not on the stumps
on the middle and tapped to mid-wicket
defended on the front foot, played away to mid-wicket
fuller on the middle stump and driven down the ground for a single
round the stumps, no turn this time, quicker on the off stump and he defends on the back foot
on the off stump, flatter and Pollard defends again, no more of slogging after losing his bat last over!
on the middle stump, from round the stumps and defended to the right of the bowler
round the stumps, fuller and driven back to the bowler, almost carries!
slightly quicker and defended back to the bowler
drifting on his pads and wants to tap it away down the leg side but the turn defeats that stroke and the leading edge goes to the backward point region
defended on the off side to one on the middle
fuller on the leg stump, driven to mid-on
almost, check shot that carries to the point fielder, it was quicker and sharper turn, the check shot flies to the off side but not to hand
round the stumps, on the off stump, gets his bat out and defends, inside edge to the leg side
outside the off stump and he pushes it to point, comes over quickly for a single
straighter, on the middle stump, no turn here, and he pushes the bat forward, inside edge to the leg side
fuller on the middle stump, smothers the turn by defending on the front foot

dropped by Sunny again! caught and bowled chance that one, and Sunny has missed his second such chance today, it was drilled back really hard by Pollard and he had no time to react, it was coming straight at him, and hits him hard on his hands, wringing in pain!
fuller, gets the foot forward to defend, but as has been the case this innings, he gets an inside edge and rolls over to the leg side
shorter outside the off, and he wants to cut it, expected it to turn but goes straight on, beats the outside edge
and this one spins in, beats the bat and hits the pad, high on the knee roll and that is what saves him!

gone, caught behind this time! one went straight, the other spun in, Pollard was always going to be guessing this one, it was going straight on and the batsman pushed at it, gets bit of a thin outside edge through to the keeper. The bowler almost did not appeal and joined in only after the keeper went up and the umpire took a lot of time before giving the decision...did he edge it?
down the leg side, bit of turn too, and wide called
nicely flighted up to the bat, spinning back to the batsman, beats the inside edge, hits the pads
quicker, shorter and tapped away to the square-leg fielder
on a good length and he defends on the front foot, ending another maiden over that sees a wicket fall
outside the off stump, a tad too wide and he has time to push it to backward point for a single
round the stumps, floated up to the batsman, angling in and hits the pads, bit of an appeal but it was always missing the leg stump there
quicker, shorter and no turn there, the batsman thought it would turn but it went straight on to beat the inside edge, lucky to have got that bat on it
fuller on the off stump and this time he brings his foot forward and defends
on the off stump and turning away from the batsman, plays a drive at it, but to backward point
shorter this time, he is on the back foot and defended to the off side to end another good over
quicker on the leg stump, no turn and wide
on the middle stump, right up to the batsman, defended back to the bowler
drifting down to the leg stump but it turns back away and Bravo defends back
on the off stump line, not too much turn, quicker and pushed to the covers
floated up a little this time and Bravo defends very confidently this time
defence, defence and more of it, on the middle and pushed to the leg side
good line and length on the off stump, tapped to the off side, ends another good over
round the stumps and angles in, gets an inside edge on to the bat, there was an appeal for an lbw
on the off stump and he can only defend it to the off side
pulls his length back, but Thomas is on the back foot to pat it back
on the off stump and tapped to the off side, not trying to score here
on the middle stump, fuller and pushed to the covers
finally a shot in anger, or should I say finally a non-defensive stroke, driven to long-off for a single
on the middle stump, pushed to the leg side by Thomas
very short there and he rocks back to pull it away, does not get it into the gap, the square-leg fielder comes across and stops even a single
very slow and very wide down the leg side, it looked like it stuck in his hand and he was lucky not to concede five wides, Rahim does well
outside the off and defended to the short cover
floated up and pushed to short mid-wicket
outside the off, no turn and this time Thomas is able to tap it to the covers for a single
down the leg side for Bravo and he gets a chance to free his arms for the sweep, misses and that is another wide
shorter from Mahmudullah, and it turns away, Bravo was going back to punch it through the covers, but can only get it down the ground
short outside the off and he wants to cut it, does it well but is unable to find the gap
on the middle stump, tucked away to the leg side for a single, good work by the short fine-leg fielder but they get home
outside the off, turning away and he gets a long stride out, defends
shorter, and again slight turn away, defended back to the bowler
brings his bat and pad out together and defends back to the bowler
floats it above the batsman's eyeline, on the middle stump and turns it away from the batsman, defended well but well bowled there!
short of length and spins away, cuts it away to the left of point for a quickly taken run
on the off stump and that is well worked away to the right of long-on, who runs across to field it, some doubt over the second run and they don't go for it
width, short as well and rocks back before cutting it away to the deep point fielder
poor ball from him this but more vitally a very good shot, it was short alright and Thomas was able to get over it, whip it away through short fine-leg for a four!
very, very short and look at the amount of turn there! it has gone down for a wide, but whoa, that turned!
outside the off and floated up, turns back into the bat again
on the back foot, defending at one that does not turn, pushed to the off for a single
on the pads, not too much turn from there, pushed to the leg side for a single
outside the off, lot of room, but he did not know whether it would turn back into him or no, ends up missing the cut
shorter again and on middle, he goes back and pushes it to long-on for a single
floated up to the bat, on the middle and defended close to the pitch
shorter and tapped away to the off side
outside the off, not too much turn but the batsman sees it through to the keeper
shorter outside the off, but it still turns away to make things difficult for his cut, goes down the track for a single
shorter and tucks it away to deep square-leg for a single
it is fuller on the middle stump, he wants to sweep it and he unleashes it well before stopping the stroke halfway through, flies off to the leg side for a single!

what a ball Murali, bowled him! that pitches outside off, slightly shorter and fizzes past the inside edge to take the top of the stumps! in fact, it did hit a bit of an edge but what turn, that would have pleased Muralitharan, such was the turn there...six down now and this could be over quickly unless Sammy can unleash a few
straighter this time, on the off stump and Sammy defends it
fuller outside the off and driven well down the to the left of mid-off, well fielded
dropped by the captain! they keep taking wickets, they keep dropping 'em! outside the off and he went for a drive, got an outside edge and Rahim drops it
on the off stump without too much turn and defended back
slightly shorter and lot of turn, defended to the leg side

run-out chance, but it hits the batsman! that would have been miles out, the batsman was going for it, then had to turn around to get back to the crease, the throw came from short fine-leg but hits Sammy and that saves him!
on the middle, tucked to the leg side
defended back to the bowler
on the front foot and tries to defend but the amount of turn there is, it beats the inside edge, hits the pads and there is a huge appeal, not-out given
defended to the leg side after he covers the stumps, Bravo wants a single but is sent back in time
another one that gets a lot of turn, tries to tuck it to the leg side, hits the pads
on the middle stump, defended back to the bowler
uppishly whipped across to the left of short mid-wicket and they are able to get a single here
another one that turns away prodigiously, but it is slightly short of length, allows the batsman to go back to try and cut, can only get it till short covers
no turn, straighter, Sammy was playing for the turn, and beats the outside edge
fuller on the off stump, leans into the drive and gets it to long-off for a single
shorter from Gazi and he goes back, punches it down the ground for a single
shorter and turns back into the batsman, it was slow turn and Sammy is able to defend
and it goes straighter this time, Sammy is on the back foot and gets his bat down
on the leg stump, flicked away to the deep square-leg fielder for a single
short of length and is able to push it to the leg side
short of length and Sammy is a tad awkward trying to fend it off, gets a single to the fine-leg fielder
short of length, tapped to the off side and he is off for a quick one, the run-trickle continues
short of length, outside the off and he brings out that drive, on the up, a lot of flair but no placement, straight to the fielder
length ball on the off stump, defended back to the bowler
short of length, pushed to the leg side and they are off for a quick, and a tad risky single
short of length and he cuts it hard, goes straight to the point fielder
quicker, comes into the batsman and slightly down the leg side, there was that customary shriek for an lbw, but not given, rightly so
shorter this time and tapped down the ground for a single
short of length, turning back into the batsman and he defends it to the leg side
sweeps it hard and wow, did I just see a boundary? yes it does, finally a four for Bravo, something to feel good about for the side
pushes it gently down the ground and they take a single, oh wait, they are going for the second run as well, and complete it very easily!
outside the off stump, short of length and pushed to the off side
on the middle stump and fuller and driven down the ground for a single
fuller on the middle and that is driven through the extra-cover region for a four by Bravo, wasn't the slower one either and that helped the batsman too, two fours in as many overs!
short of length and punched to the point fielder
outside the off and beats the outside edge of the bat, he was going for a full bloodied drive, but does not get any bat
short of length, pushed to the off side for a quick single
fuller and driven to mid-on, to the fielder
short again and is able to go back and push it back to the bowler
changes the length this time, gets it fuller up to the bat, tucks it to the leg side for a single
short of length, outside the off stump, spins away, patted away to the off side
on the length and defended back to the bowler
fuller from round the stumps and flicks it away to mid-wicket, only one off this one
bit of turn away from the left-hander, plays it to short third-man and fielded well by Tamim, for a single only
outside the off and very short, there was some turn alright but Sammy cuts it powerfully through the covers for a four
full on the pads and that is drilled, but straight to the mid-wicket fielder
shorter from the bowler, punched down to long-on for a single
fuller and on the leg stump, driven inside out to long-on
gets his front foot out to defend, beats the inside edge and hits his pads, there is a shout for an lbw, but was hitting outside off
down the leg side, and spinning further away, wide called by the umpire
fuller and on off stump, he is getting back and pushing it to off side
defended to the off side to a fuller one
pushes it quicker and that is cut away to the deep point fielder
slower on the middle and defended by the captain
very, very short, and that is well cut by Sammy, but poorly fielded at the deep cover fence, goes through the fielder for a four!
fuller on the off stump and driven back to the bowler
slower, shorter and turning away from the batsman, he tries to cut it away, and gets it through to deep cover
on the off stump and the turn beats his bat, hits him flush on the pads but going down the leg side
another one not too different, hitting his pads yet again because of the vicious turn
goes down the track, it is a tad shorter and he cracks it to long-on
shorter this time, and he tries to cut it away, well played that, runs away to the deep cover for a single
outside the off and Sammy was shaping to slog it but in the end, pushes it to the off side
round the stumps, on the middle and defended to the leg side
flighted up to the bat and drilled powerfully through the covers, even if there had been a fielder there, he wouldn't have got a hand I feel, such was the power!
short of length and he goes on to the back foot to cut it, deep point comes into the picture
shorter this time, outside edge goes to short third-man for a quick single
soft dismissal, caught and bowled! it was slower, Bravo wanted to turn it away to the leg side but he only manages to push it back to the bowler and lo and behold! he accepts a caught-and-bowled!
turns back into the batsman, hits the pads and flies up to the keeper, there is a big appeal for something, but either way it is declared not-out
outside the off and that has been pummelled over the bowler's head for a six! this was to be expected now that Bravo is out, 150 comes up
and what turn this time, shorter as expected and he wants to cut it away, gets an inside edge to fine-leg
outside the off stump, slog swept it away by the new man, goes on the bounce to the deep mid-wicket fielder
and he sends it down the leg side, probably slightly afraid that Sammy would come down the wicket
short of length, pushed back down the ground for a single

outside the off and he goes for a slog sweep, but the top-edge carries to the deep square-leg fielder, easily caught! why would he play this shot when he has six overs remaining and his captain batting well at the other end?
outside the off and driven to the long-off fielder to retain strike
shorter outside the off and he goes for a cut, outside edge to the short third-man for a single
short of length and Narine is able to tuck it away to the leg side for a single
fuller on the off and driven down the ground for a single
outside the off and Narine has done well to drive it through the covers for a single
shorter, and wider, is able to cut it away but more vitally, pick up a single as well.
short of length and Narine has played a very nicely executed cut shot, through the backward point region for a four! valuable runs these
short of length but slower, he is on the back foot and defending it back to the bowler
short of length and dropped! that was pulled well but it went straight to the fielder, Gazi there on the boundary and it should have been caught, goes through his hands!
another one on length and he tucks it round the corner for a single
on the middle and just going away from the bat, misses the outside edge, did well to not get one in fact

that is the shot of the game, or at least the mis-shot of the game for sure! it was on the middle and Narine swivelled across to play it over mid-wicket, flies off the leading edge to bisect the third-man and deep cover fielders!
short of length and on the off, punched down the ground for a single
and that, I think is the shot of the game, coming from a number 10! was flighted up and on the off stump, he went after it and hits it inside out through the covers for a four!

reverse-sweep and caught! wow! I rub my eyes to check whether those last two balls were batted by a number 10, one driven inside out for a four and this time he tries to smash a reverse sweep, gets a top edge to point and he is on his way!
very quick, into the batsman, who tries to cut it away, gets it to the covers for a single, number 11 on strike now
on the middle stump and defended back to the bowler
on the off stump, and defended to the off side
slower, shorter, outside the off, invites him to have a go, but defended to the off side
down the leg side and Sammy, who wanted to go at it, lets it go through for a wide
short of length and tucked away for a single, the number 11 is back on strike

down the leg side yet again and he lets it go, it has been declared a wide and what will hurt more is that the keeper fumbles as well, allowing them to cross over for a couple. Looked like it came off the thigh pad
whoa, outside the off and that has been hit through the covers for three, it is Roach who has managed to time it that well
short of length on the off and tapped and quickly set off for a run, the fielder gets around but they are away rather well are the two batsmen
outside the off, swinging away, yes, it did nip away after hitting the seam and beats the outside edge
outside the off, fuller and defended to the off side with bat and pad together
edged and almost to the slip, and yes there is a wide slip in place, goes to him on the first bounce
goes for a thwack over the extra-cover, does not get close to the middle of the bat but falls in no-man's land
on the leg stump and defended back to the bowler
whoa, a huge six! it was fuller and on the middle, smacks it over deep square-leg for a six!
fuller on the off stump, drilled back to the bowler
cuts it away to the backward point fence for a four, it was short and wide and the point fielder fails to get his hand on it
chips it up over extra-cover for a single to retain the strike, moving on to within a run of his half-century
down the leg side and that is the umpteenth wide that Mahmudullah has bowled today
pitched right up to the bat, full and darted in and he has absolutely whacked it through mid-wicket for a four, bringing up fifty for Sammy and 200 for West Indies!
tries to bowl it quicker and he sends it down the leg side for another wide!
on the middle and he has smacked it to the long-off fielder, falls just short and whoa, that is excellent running from Sammy, manages to get back for the second
drilled back to the bowler, to one that is very full, fielded rather well this time
quicker one, short of length and Sammy fails to pull it away
and watching he was this time! he has slammed it through the covers for a four, taken on a full and well stroked away
wants to slog it away but can get it away to mid-wicket for a single only, the captain isn't happy but he has done a superb job here has Sammy

inn2.comm: whoa, ripper first ball from Roach! it was on the middle stump and it has zipped past the outside edge there, through to the keeper
short of length this time and angles away from the batsman, batsman half-leaves, half-fiddles at it, but in the end it goes through to the keeper
down the leg side for the first wide of the innings, this one was swinging back into the left-hander but it was pitched on leg and swung further down
short and not too quick, Tamim went after it and gets it to the deep square-leg region where there is a fielder, seems like it did not hit the middle
fuller on the pads and that has been flicked away to fine-leg for a single
short of length and cramps him for space, hits him high on the thigh pad, rolls over to the off side
and a jaffa to end the over, it was pitched up and swung away from the batsman, he went for a drive but gts nowhere close to the outside edge
outside the of and swinging away, he goes for the drive and there is an appeal for a caught-behind...not given and it did not seem to have hit anything
fuller and on the middle, defended back to the bowler
fuller again, bit outside the off stump that allows him some room, driven to the wide mid-off but straight to him

leading edge and gone! Bangladesh may have dropped caught-and-bowleds but West Indies won't do that here! it was a length ball and he tries to work it away to the leg side, gets bit of a leading edge and it goes back to the bowler, Sammy takes a simple catch over his head and West Indies draw first blood.

edged and gone, caught in the slips! now, the dew does seem to have come on, and under the lights it has made the ball wobble a little, away from the batsman, he went for the drive, more of a push I think and the outside edge goes through to the second slip, well caught low down.
on the length and straighter, does not swing any place and hits Rahim on his pads, but too high to be given out lbw
outside the off, angling wide away and Tamim goes for a slash, misses getting anywhere close to it and that's through the keeper, wide called
short of length and Tamim's on the back foot, has to get his gloves right in front of his face to defend, but does a good job in the end

gone, bowled, too quick! softens him up with the previous ball and this one is on a length, deviates slightly into the batsman and the defence is opened up by that one, hits the top of the stumps and the bails are sent flying
too quick, too short and the batsman tries to fend it away, lucky it is down the leg side and a wide's called
outside the off and goes for a cut, misses the outside edge
short of length and he gets time to try and upper cut it, it does not come on as quickly as he would have liked and it goes to the left of the third-man fielder for a couple

edged and gone, or is it? there was a genuine nick there and the ball was taken by the keeper, the question is whether the ball bounced before it went into the keeper's gloves and the replays tell me that yes, it's gone straight into the gloves, cannot give that not-out. Yep, given out, four down and in gargantuan trouble.
short of length, outside the off stump and with three slips waiting behind, he gets behind it well and defends, the ball almost rolls back
on the off stump and gets it to swing away from the bat, almost another outside edge, a lot happening every ball here
this is slightly wider outside the off and lets it go through to the keeper, does the captain
on the off stump, fuller and defended to the off side, not for runs though
down the leg side this time and while it is very quick, it is wide too, left all alone
down the leg side I think to that appeal for an lbw, it was angling into the batsman and misses the bat, hits the knee roll, prompting a huge appeal from Sammy, not given
swinging away from the batsman, pitched short of length and he opens the face of the bat through to third-man for a single
swinging down the leg side, gets some pad on the way, tickled down for a leg-bye
another one beats the outside edge of the bat, no swing this time but the pace is too hot to handle for him.
short of length and tapped to the leg side, on the back foot, and wants a single, but Rahim sends him back
short of length and the batsman is on the back foot yet again, tries to defend it back, somehow manages to keep it out
outside the off, wider and fuller and he is sucked into playing at it, misses the outside edge
shot sir! one of the first good ones, short ball, and he goes for a pull, hits it well, goes to backward square-leg and Narine fields well
quick, angling in and then jags away, squares the captain up, who gets an outside edge to the third-man fielder for a single
pitched right up to the bat, bit of swing and pushed to the mid-on fielder
poor ball, down the leg side, he flicks it away, but it's not off the middle and it goes to fine-leg for a single

short and pulled to the fielder! half their side is gone even before the late-comers must have taken their seats after the break. short and worth pulling and he does just that, only problem is that he neither keeps it down, nor gets it over the fielder at square-leg, its hit straight to Pollard and another one has bitten the dust. Or the dew.
inside edge and almost a wicket! in fact Sammy thought that it was bowled and went on a victory lap but finding no support, he realised it had missed the stumps, goes to fine-leg for a single
outside the off and lets it go alone through to the keeper
slower in the air this time, on the off stump and bit of nip away, defended to the off side
outside the off stump, pushed to the covers
short of length, in fact it is very short and the batsman is able to go down easily
outside the off, short of length and pushed through the covers for a couple of runs
short of length on the off stump and he is pegged on the back foot, defends it to the off side
goes down the leg side, it was quick too and hits the pad, runs away to fine-leg for a leg-bye
short of length on the middle and angling into the batsman, goes down the leg side, he leaves it alone there for a wide
another one that is not bowled in the batsman's half, Rahim's on the back foot, defended to the off side
good length ball on the off stump, defended to the off side by the captain
poor ball, down the leg side and he lets it go through for a wide,
fuller, on the off stump, driven to mid-off but straight to the fielder
outside the off and that is some movement away from the bat, the good news is that he can leave it alone because it wasn't close enough
he pitches it right up to the bat, on the middle, driven to mid-on
lovely, crisply driven past the bowler for a four, the first of the innings! it was fuller and drives it to the right of mid-on, well played
and make that two in two, that is a risky stroke to play, across the line off one that is on the off stump, swinging away but takes it away through to the mid-wicket
what a ripper! that is on the middle stump, angling in and swinging away from the batsman, misses the outside edge
outside the off, swinging away from the bat, lets it go alone
huge appeal for an lbw, that one was coming back into the batsman and he thought it will go away, his bat is far away from the pads and is lucky to get an inside edge into the pads
outside the off and he lets it go alone through to the keeper
on his pads, fuller and flicked away to the fine-leg fielder, who runs across to deep square-leg and with a bit of a fancy footwork, fields it well
short of length and on the off stump, defends it to the off side
on the off stump and tapped away for another single
outside the off stump, swinging further away from the batsman, leaves it all alone
short of length and that also jags away but not at too much pace, squares up Rahim who plays it well to third-man for a single
whoa, what a shot under pressure! he goes down the track and smacks it over the mid-off region for a four, good shot but I shudder to think what would have happened had he missed that
on the middle stump, short of length, defended to the leg side
swing away from the batsman and he manages to tap it through point for a single
almost another edge through to the keeper, keeps it up to the bat and beaten outside the off stump
short of length and he manages to keep it down, playing through the slips for a single
short of length, and Rahim goes on to the back foot, defends it back to the bowler
and this one comes into the batsman, late swing into Rahim and he misses the inside edge, hits the pad but going far down the leg stump
outside the off and leaves it alone, it was short of length without swing
short of length and pushed to the point fielder, quickly away for a single
another excellent shot from Mahmudullah, this is good batting, short of length and there is no swing, the batsman punches it through the covers and for a four!
outside the off, shorter in length and he is able to push it to the off side
drifts down the leg stump there, aided by the swing that is definitely around, flicked away to fine-leg for a single
edged and eludes the third-man, the nip away gets the outside half of the bat, but there is only one slip and it misses his outstretched hands
short of length and swinging away, tries to defend it but just eludes the outside edge there, through to the keeper

big, big appeal from Sammy, and it was more than just an appeal, he jumped up and down in a manner that would have done Javed Miandad of the 1992 World Cup proud, short of length and Rahim wanted to play it through to the third-man, misses the outside edge
on the middle stump, tucked round the corner for a single
huge turn for Narine now! from outside the off stump to leg-stump, where is the dew? given not-out, but Rahim wasn't playing a stroke there
quicker, straighter, bit of movement away from the bat there
straightish ball, quicker too and defended back to the bowler
turn back into the batsman, slow turn alright but defended to the off side
carrom-ball, but very short and blazed away through the point region for a single
fuller on the off stump, deviating away from the batsman, who defends really well, tapped back to the bowler
outside the off stump from Sammy in his seventh over, leaves it alone this time
on the middle, not a great line and the batsman is able to play it through square-leg for a single
short of length and that half pull gets it to the mid-wicket, the mid-on runs across to field
outside the off and Rahim is not taking the bait, lets it go through
plays at it outside the off stump and the extra bounce almost gets him, hits the shoulder of the bat and flies towards point, on the bounce
outside the off and he gets back to leaving them alone
wow, a yorker-length delivery and that comes as a surprise, but well defended there
fuller and on the middle from round the stumps, pushed to the left of the bowler
on the middle, on the good length, defended to the leg side
poor ball from Permaul, shorter in length, outside the off as well and gives him ample time to tap it through the covers for a four
down the leg side, no turn there and it touches his pad, Thomas does not collect it too well and they go through for a single
loud appeal for an lbw, it was from round the stumps, quicker, straighter and hits his pads but given not-out, probably because it was going down
outside the off and wants to cut it, there was no turn there and skids straight through to the keeper, misses the outside edge
pushes it away to the point region and takes a single, wants to go for the second, but sent back
big appeal there and given not-out! Rahim did not offer a stroke to that one and that was turning straight into the stumps I feel, lot of spin alright but he is lucky to be there!
shorter this time, carrom-ball and pushed to the off side for a single
shorter from Narine, angling into the batsman, hits his pads as he tries to tuck it round the corner
defended on the front foot, outside the off stump and played well
drifts down the leg side, taps away to the deep fielder for a single
round the stumps, quicker and angling back into the batsman, he tries to defend at it but hits the pads, not-out to the appeal that follows
on the middle stump and defended back
outside the off stump and cut away to the deep point fielder for a single
fuller on the middle and driven back to the bowler
slog swept away for a four, that is one of the first strokes of aggression by Rahim and it is gone to the deep square-leg fence, well played skip!
down the leg side and it rushes away to the fence for five wides, poor delivery and bad keeping
and another one and another five wides, whatever happened before that over! it was spinning down the leg-side and Thomas misses it yet again, goes to the fence
outside the off and not too much turn, goes between pad and bat
turn again, into the batsman, hits him on his pads but he well forward
carom ball, going away from the batsman, beats him all end, misses the outside edge by a mile
and now one that comes back into him, again misses the bat and hits the thigh pad, rolls over to the off side
outside edge and that's run away through the slips for four, good over for the home team!
short of length and turns back into the bat, he allows it to hit his pad and it pops up for the short-leg fielder to take an easy take, except that it had not hit the bat
on the middle stump, slower and turning away from the batsman, tries to drive at it and it lobs up in the air, goes to mid-off
outside the off and keeps a little low, wants to cut it but misses the middle of the bat
driven down the ground for a single
fuller on the off stump, pushed to the point region for a single
fuller on the off stump and driven but straight to the fielder at short cover
outside the off, wants to cut at it, but straight to the fielder again
spins back into the batsman, lot of it, wants to cut against it, inside edge back to the bowler
short of length and this time he is able to cut it away to deep point for a couple
and this goes through straighter, Rahim continues to attempt cutting it, misses the outside edge
carom-ball, goes away from the bat, misses the outside edge
quicker on the middle stump and defended back to the bowler
outside the off and a lot of flight but Rahim goes for the slog sweep, goes to the fence for a four
round the stumps, defended to the off side
shorter and on the middle stump, defended to the leg side
fuller and turn away from the batsman, he went for a cut, misses the outside edge
on his pads and easily tucked away to the fine-leg region for a single
on the middle stump, from round the stumps, goes really back and taps it to the off side for a single
outside edge and it rolls over to the first slip, this time Gayle gets a hand to it
huge turn into the batsman but he is well forward before it hits his pads this time

gone, stumped off the carom ball! it was a wonderful ball, one that almost deserved the wicket, it was on off and it spun away at some pace. Rahim was looking to drive it straight, and missed, over balanced as well and before he could return back, the keeper had removed the bails...big wicket at a crucial time
another one, carom-ball, and beaten! that is a ripper again, how do you play those!
three in a row, that is an awesome delivery outside the off, beats the outside edge again
outside the off and he goes for a cut this time, misses the outside edge
and now he wants to sweep, hits it hard and straight to the short-leg fielder
outside the off and gorgeous drive through the covers for a four, super shot!
on the pads and tucked away to fine-leg, but not for a run
on the off stump and no turn for him, defended to the off side
down the ground, manages to get bit of an inside edge through to wide long-on and that allows him to come back for the second
short of length, and punched through the covers for a single
short of length and that is punched through the leg side for a single
outside the off and slower in the air, bit of turn away and defended well
on the middle stump with no turn and he goes for a sweep, had that gone through the shout for lbw would have been ear-bursting
on that outside the off line, is able to tap it to the off side for a single
on the pads, tucked away to the leg side
outside the off stump and cut away to the deep point for a single
very short from Narine and not too much turn, he is able to defend it back to the bowler
slower, shorter and on the off stump, pushed to short mid-wicket
flighted up to the middle stump, defended back to the bowler
short, wide and cut away by Gazi; that is an excellent shot from the number eight
on the off stump and little turn away, tucks to the leg side
shorter this time and easily nudged away to square-leg for a couple of runs
floated up in the air, and he gets his bat and pad together and defends
on the middle and he tries to whip it away, just eludes the short-leg fielder
goes for a slog sweep, but it was too full to do that, misses
this one goes away from the batsman, opens the face of the bat and guides it through point for a single
on the middle stump, tucked away to the leg side for a single
shorter from Narine, and some turn back, defended by the batsman there
outside the off and that rips back into the batsman, defended forward, hits the pads
yorker length, on the off and drilled away, back to the bowler
down the leg side, it was angling into the batsman, and he lets it go through, for a wide
short of length and defended back to the bowler this time
bouncer and he ducks under it, one for the over called by the umpire
short of length and it angles back into the batsman, he was on the back foot and just about manages to keep it away
wow, another one short of length and that is tucked away well to mid-wicket for a single
another bouncer and this is not only high but it is also wide down the leg side, called so by the umpire
attempted yorker but does not get the line right, it is down the leg side, flicked away for a single
too short, too wide and that is crashed through the covers, almost looks like it will go through to the fence but Samuels dives at the fence and prevents a four

whoa, given out, lbw, no given out caught? interesting one this, he was playing for the turn and it goes straight on, probably misses the bat and hits the pad, goes over the stumps and to the keeper, who holds it. the bowlers appealed for that one and the umpire raises his finger, but not sure whether he is out caught-behind or lbw!

gone, first ball, bowled! this is getting over far too quickly here, outside the off and that one turns in sharply, in fact this is one of the few that Permaul has really ripped, the batsman was very late on the stroke, got his bat down very late and by the time he did that, it had gone through to rattle the timber
fuller on the leg stump and he drives it inside out to the short cover
and more turn for Permaul, that beats the outside edge of the bat
defended on the front foot, with all those fielders around the bat, back to the bowler
short of length and he goes for a pull, gives himself some room there
short of a length and he is pinned on the back foot, defended a tad awkwardly
bouncer and going down the leg side, he goes under this time, no more of giving room and slogging for now
on the off, length ball and defended to the off side
short of length outside the off and he manages to play it through to third-man for a single

loud appeal for a caught-behind and this, to me, seemed like an edge, or at least sounded like one, the appeal was pretty spontaneous too, but the umpire gives it not-out. length ball and he was on his back foot to defend, misses it.
down the leg side and a wide called, he was going for a sweep
on the leg stump again, and pushed to mid-wicket, remains on 49
on the off stump, driven down the ground and for a single, bringing him his eighth ODI fifty, well-played under pressure and without too much support
fullish from round the stumps and driven to long-off
and that is the third single in a row to long-off for a single, bowling it quite full here
and he tries a fourth single to the same spot but gets it to short cover
ooh, outside the off and beats the edge, through to the keeper, to bring up drinks
short of length and pulled away to mid-wicket for a single
short of length, on the off stump, bit of bounce there and pushed to the covers
short of length and more within the stumps now, tucked away to the leg side for a single
outside the off this time and swinging further away from the batsman, he fiddled at it and was lucky not to get an outside edge

short of length and this time he gets a short-arm jab going, gets a couple of runs, the throw comes in from the deep and hits the stump direct, Mortaza was running a tad too casually, had not grounded his bat but fortunately for him, his toe was just over the crease. Poor running and lucky to be still there.
short and he wanted to play that same jab, but this is quicker and it goes through to the keeper
on his pads and played away down to fine-leg, that was tucked away really fine
on the middle stump and defended back to the bowler
fuller on the off stump and defended to the short cover region
this goes down the leg side, tries to flick it away but does not get the bat there and gets a wide
outside the off and taps away to the off side, completes a run quickly
bouncer from Sammy and he just evades it by swaying away from the line
short of length and he was going for it, pops up over the keeper and goes away for a couple of runs, given as leg-byes by the umpire
fuller on the off stump, driven down to mid-off
short of length and he opens the face of the bat and plays it down to third-man for a single
shorter and angling into the batsman, he patiently goes back and defends from the crease
outside the off, and he opens the face of the bat, through to the third-man for a single
gone, this time, out, lbw, was fuller and nipped back into the batsman, he was on the back-foot and hits him on the back pad, given out and rightly so!
on his pads, fuller, flicked away to wide mid-on and they are able to get away for a single
lot of turn from outside the off stump, goes further away and Razzaq has nothing to do with it
closer to the stumps and straighter, beats the outside edge, through to the keeper
short of length, no turn and on middle, punched down the ground for a single
on the off stump, straighter and cut away to third-man for a single
short of length, turn but too slow and easy to read given the length, opens the face of the bat, hits to the off side
quicker this time and bit of bite, tucked to short fine-leg but goes too quickly to him and not for runs

given out, caught in the slips it was on the middle and went through quickly and seemed to have gotten an inside edge on to his pads, popped up for the slips to take a simple catch! Oh wait, the umpire has given it out lbw, but there did seem to be an inside edge, one way or the other he was out, so the right decision was given there.
